text: New York Stock Exchange is the largest
capital market in the world.
It's a massive ecosystem.
NYSE is the center of capital markets.
We process billions of transactions
and the record volume that we have done
is half a trillion messages.
And with the advent of new technologies
and new trading strategies,

all the computers around
the world have grown.

And what it does is that it
produces massive amount of data.
It's a massive challenge to look at each

and every aspect of the
transactions that happened.
So before we migrated our system to AWS,

at that time, we would
face a lot of challenges
with our limited compute, limited storage.

AWS is the most mature cloud
provider from what I can see.
Once we migrated to AWS,
our day-to-day operational challenges,
were not there anymore.

So we started focusing
on advanced analytics
and machine learning.

We have been actively
involved in all the LLM
and AI initiatives across the company.

We use Amazon Bedrock to
try out different models
and deploy for our gen AI use cases.

We are heavily investing
time to understand gen AI,
not only from technology aspect,
but compliance, performance,
and all the aspects of it.

What we are doing is
that we are using gen AI
for productivity use cases.
We are solving the problem,

where we find that there
is some manual work
going on right now.
To give you some ideas,
we are building a Trading Rules Document
Intelligence Chatbot

so that anybody can ask the
question about trading rules.
We took 20,000 pages of rules,
not only for NYC Stock Exchange,
but across all US exchanges.

And what we have done
is that we have made it
more user-friendly to ask questions.
If you have been to any legal meeting,
the kind of terminology that is used
is hard for any layman to understand.

And trading rules are
not dissimilar to that,
in the sense that they are very complex
and it comes up with its own challenges.
So in order to have more efficient
and productive usage of the tech talent

we are building a Document
Intelligence Tool.

The other use case we are
doing on Bedrock and on AWS,
basically is new sentiment analysis.

So we are taking a raw news
feed with unstructured data.

We are using LLM models
to summarize the news
and then do sentiment analysis
on the stock price movement based on that.
So these are productivity use cases.
Today the workflow is quite manual
so we are solving using AWS.
We work closely with the Bedrock team.

And in the last few weeks,
the number of services
that we have used and number of ML model

that we have been able to
validate with fine-tuning
and with the RAG,

all these things has been
very flexible with Bedrock
and it is quicker time to market.
We are able to test all these things,
see the comparison with different model,
different performance criteria.
So that's what Bedrock brings in.
